title: Romans Chapter 3 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Romans chapter 3 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Romans Chapter 3 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Romans Chapter 3.

questions.question: What advantage does the Jew have according to Romans 3:1?
questions.correctAnswer: Much every way
questions.explanation: Romans 3:2 explains that the advantage is 'Much every way', chiefly because the oracles of God were committed to them.

questions.question: According to Romans 3:4, what is said about God and man?
options: God is true, every man a liar
God is a man, and man is God
Man is true, but God lies
Both God and man are liars
questions.correctAnswer: God is true, every man a liar
questions.explanation: Romans 3:4 says, 'God be true, but every man a liar,' emphasizing God's truthfulness over human falsehood.

questions.question: What does Romans 3:10 say about righteousness?
options: There is none righteous, no, not one
questions.correctAnswer: There is none righteous, no, not one
questions.explanation: Romans 3:10 states clearly that 'There is none righteous, no, not one,' indicating universal sinfulness.

questions.question: According to Romans 3:12, what is said about those who do good?
options: There is none that doeth good, no, not one
questions.correctAnswer: There is none that doeth good, no, not one
questions.explanation: Romans 3:12 says, 'there is none that doeth good, no, not one,' emphasizing universal sin.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Their throat is an open ______; with their tongues they have used deceit.'
questions.correctAnswer: sepulchre
questions.explanation: Romans 3:13 says, 'Their throat is an open sepulchre; with their tongues they have used deceit.'

questions.question: What does Romans 3:20 say about justification by the deeds of the law?
options: No flesh shall be justified by the deeds of the law
All are justified by the deeds of the law
Only Jews are justified by the law
Gentiles are justified by the law
questions.correctAnswer: No flesh shall be justified by the deeds of the law
questions.explanation: Romans 3:20 states that no one will be justified by the deeds of the law, but the law shows knowledge of sin.

questions.question: According to Romans 3:22, by what are we justified?
questions.correctAnswer: Faith of Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Romans 3:22 teaches that righteousness comes by faith in Jesus Christ to all who believe.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 3:23 says all have sinned and come short of the glory of God.
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Romans 3:23 clearly states, 'For all have sinned, and come short of the glory of God.'

questions.question: Who is the propitiation through faith in his blood, according to Romans 3:25?
questions.correctAnswer: Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Romans 3:25 identifies Christ Jesus as the one God set forth as a propitiation through faith in His blood.

questions.question: What does Romans 3:27 say about boasting?
questions.correctAnswer: Boasting is excluded
questions.explanation: Romans 3:27 states, 'Where is boasting then? It is excluded,' emphasizing that boasting is not allowed.

questions.question: True or False: According to Romans 3:31, faith makes void the law.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Romans 3:31 says 'Do we then make void the law through faith? God forbid: yea, we establish the law.'

questions.question: Who are justified by faith according to Romans 3:30?
questions.correctAnswer: Both circumcision and uncircumcision
questions.explanation: Romans 3:30 states God justifies both the circumcised and uncircumcised through faith.

questions.question: What is the result for all who believe, as stated in Romans 3:22?
options: They receive the righteousness of God
They are judged by the law
questions.correctAnswer: They receive the righteousness of God
questions.explanation: Romans 3:22 says righteousness of God is by faith for all who believe.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 3:9 concludes that Jews are better than Gentiles.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Romans 3:9 says 'No, in no wise,' indicating neither Jews nor Gentiles are better as all are under sin.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the law according to Romans 3:19-20?
options: To make all the world guilty before God
questions.correctAnswer: To make all the world guilty before God
questions.explanation: Romans 3:19-20 explains that the law stops every mouth and makes the world guilty, showing knowledge of sin.

medium.title: Romans Chapter 3 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Romans Chapter 3 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer struggles with feelings of guilt over sin. Based on Romans 3, what biblical truth would you share about justification?
options: Justification comes freely by God's grace through the redemption in Christ Jesus
Justification is earned by obeying the law perfectly
Only the Jews can be justified by God
questions.correctAnswer: Justification comes freely by God's grace through the redemption in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Romans 3:24 teaches that we are justified freely by God's grace through the redemption in Christ Jesus, emphasizing that justification is a gift, not earned by law (Romans 3:20, 3:21, 3:28).

questions.question: How does Romans 3 instruct us about humility in relation to boasting?
options: Boasting is excluded because justification is by faith, not works
Boasting is encouraged when we follow the law
Boasting is acceptable if done humbly
questions.correctAnswer: Boasting is excluded because justification is by faith, not works
questions.explanation: Romans 3:27-28 clearly states that boasting is excluded because justification comes by the law of faith, not by works or deeds of the law.

questions.question: A believer wonders if God's faithfulness is affected by others' unbelief. What does Romans 3 say about God's faithfulness?
options: God's faithfulness remains true even if some do not believe
God's faithfulness depends on everyone believing
God loses faithfulness when people doubt
God changes His promises based on human belief
questions.correctAnswer: God's faithfulness remains true even if some do not believe
questions.explanation: Romans 3:3-4 explains that even if some do not believe, God's faithfulness is not nullified; God is true though every person is a liar.

questions.question: What does Romans 3 teach about the condition of all humanity concerning sin?
options: All have sinned and come short of the glory of God
questions.correctAnswer: All have sinned and come short of the glory of God
questions.explanation: Romans 3:9-10 and 3:23 affirm that both Jews and Gentiles are under sin, and none is righteous; all have sinned and fall short of God's glory.

questions.question: In dealing with temptation to do wrong, how does Romans 3 guide believers regarding doing evil so that good may come?
options: We must not do evil that good may come; such teaching is condemned
Doing evil is allowable if the outcome is good
Evil acts are justified by faith
We should ignore evil and focus on good
questions.correctAnswer: We must not do evil that good may come; such teaching is condemned
questions.explanation: Romans 3:8 rejects the idea of doing evil so that good may come and states that those who teach this face just condemnation.

questions.question: True or False: According to Romans 3, the law can justify a person by their deeds.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Romans 3:20 states that by the deeds of the law no one will be justified because the law reveals knowledge of sin, not righteousness.

questions.question: How does Romans 3 encourage believers to view God's judgment in light of human unrighteousness?
options: God is just and will judge the world rightly despite human unrighteousness
God is unfair because of human sin
Judgment is based on human self-righteousness
questions.correctAnswer: God is just and will judge the world rightly despite human unrighteousness
questions.explanation: Romans 3:5-6 emphasizes that God is not unrighteous and will judge the world justly, despite human sinfulness.

questions.question: What truth about faith and the law does Romans 3 convey to help believers live faithfully?
options: Faith establishes the law rather than nullifies it
The law is more important than faith
questions.correctAnswer: Faith establishes the law rather than nullifies it
questions.explanation: Romans 3:31 teaches that faith does not nullify the law, but rather upholds and establishes it.

questions.question: A believer asks how God shows His righteousness through Jesus. What does Romans 3 say about this?
options: God set Jesus forth as a propitiation through faith in His blood for remission of sins
Jesus was set forth to enforce the law strictly
God shows righteousness by human works
questions.correctAnswer: God set Jesus forth as a propitiation through faith in His blood for remission of sins
questions.explanation: Romans 3:25 explains that God presented Jesus as a propitiation by faith in His blood to declare righteousness and forgive past sins.

questions.question: True or False: According to Romans 3, only the Jews can be justified by faith in God.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Romans 3:29-30 clarifies that God is the God of both Jews and Gentiles, justifying all by faith, regardless of circumcision.

questions.question: How does Romans 3 describe the speech and behavior of those under sin, and what practical lesson can believers learn from this?
options: Their tongues deceive and their mouths are full of cursing, so believers should practice honesty and wholesome speech
They speak only truth and kindness
questions.correctAnswer: Their tongues deceive and their mouths are full of cursing, so believers should practice honesty and wholesome speech
questions.explanation: Romans 3:13-14 describes deceitful tongues and cursing; believers are encouraged to avoid such speech and exemplify honesty and kindness.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: 'Therefore we conclude that a man is justified by ______ without the deeds of the law.'
questions.correctAnswer: faith
questions.explanation: Romans 3:28 teaches that justification is by faith alone, not by the deeds of the law.

questions.question: A believer is struggling to understand the role of the law. Based on Romans 3, what does the law primarily reveal?
questions.correctAnswer: The knowledge of sin
questions.explanation: Romans 3:20 shows that the law's primary function is to make us aware of sin, not to justify us.

questions.question: How does Romans 3 teach believers to share the gospel with both Jews and Gentiles?
options: God justifies all who believe by faith, regardless of circumcision
Only Jews should hear the gospel
Gentiles must first become Jews to be justified
The gospel is only for the circumcised
questions.correctAnswer: God justifies all who believe by faith, regardless of circumcision
questions.explanation: Romans 3:30 emphasizes that God justifies both circumcised and uncircumcised through faith, highlighting the inclusive nature of the gospel.

questions.question: According to Romans 3, what is the condition of the 'way of peace' for those under sin, and what should believers do in response?
options: They have not known the way of peace; believers should seek peace through faith in God
They create peace through their works
They are the source of peace in the world
questions.correctAnswer: They have not known the way of peace; believers should seek peace through faith in God
questions.explanation: Romans 3:17 shows those under sin do not know the way of peace, encouraging believers to pursue peace through faith and obedience.

hard.title: Romans Chapter 3 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Romans Chapter 3.

questions.question: What primary advantage does Paul attribute to the Jews in Romans 3:2?
options: They were given the oracles of God
They had the law of Moses
questions.correctAnswer: They were given the oracles of God
questions.explanation: Romans 3:2 states that the chief advantage of the Jews is that unto them were committed the oracles of God, highlighting their unique role as recipients of divine revelation.

questions.question: In Romans 3:4, Paul quotes Scripture to affirm that God is to be considered what?
options: True, even if every man is a liar
questions.correctAnswer: True, even if every man is a liar
questions.explanation: Romans 3:4 emphasizes God's truthfulness by stating 'let God be true, but every man a liar,' affirming divine faithfulness despite human unfaithfulness.

questions.question: According to Romans 3:9, who does Paul say are under sin?
questions.correctAnswer: Both Jews and Gentiles
questions.explanation: Romans 3:9 clearly states that both Jews and Gentiles are all under sin, emphasizing the universal condition of humanity apart from righteousness.

questions.question: Which Old Testament book is Paul most likely alluding to in Romans 3:10-18 when listing the sins and failures of humanity?
questions.correctAnswer: Psalms
questions.explanation: Romans 3:10-18 cites multiple phrases from Psalms (e.g., Psalm 14 and Psalm 5), illustrating humanity's sinfulness and separation from God.

questions.question: What is the function of the law according to Romans 3:20?
questions.correctAnswer: To bring knowledge of sin
questions.explanation: Romans 3:20 explains that the law's purpose is to reveal sin, not to justify anyone by their deeds, highlighting the law’s diagnostic role.

questions.question: In Romans 3:21-22, what is said to be the source of righteousness apart from the law?
questions.correctAnswer: Faith in Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Romans 3:21-22 declares that righteousness comes through faith in Jesus Christ to all who believe, demonstrating a shift from law-based to faith-based justification.

questions.question: According to Romans 3:23, what is the universal condition of humanity?
options: All have sinned and fall short of God's glory
All are righteous in God's sight
Some have sinned, others have not
questions.correctAnswer: All have sinned and fall short of God's glory
questions.explanation: Romans 3:23 states the universal reality that all people have sinned and fall short of the glory of God, emphasizing human imperfection.

questions.question: What does Paul describe as the means by which believers are justified freely according to Romans 3:24?
options: By grace through the redemption in Christ Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: By grace through the redemption in Christ Jesus
questions.explanation: Romans 3:24 highlights that justification is a free gift of God's grace accomplished through redemption in Christ, underscoring salvation as unearned.

questions.question: In Romans 3:25, Christ is described as a "propitiation." What does this term imply in the context of the verse?
options: An atoning sacrifice through faith in his blood
A prophet who foretells the future
questions.correctAnswer: An atoning sacrifice through faith in his blood
questions.explanation: Romans 3:25 presents Jesus as a propitiation, meaning he appeases God's wrath by his sacrificial death, providing forgiveness for sins.

questions.question: How does Romans 3:27 describe the role of boasting in justification?
options: Boasting is excluded by the law of faith
Boasting is allowed through the law
questions.correctAnswer: Boasting is excluded by the law of faith
questions.explanation: Romans 3:27 teaches that boasting is excluded because justification comes by faith, not by works, which nullifies human pride.

questions.question: According to Romans 3:28, how is a person justified before God?
options: By faith apart from works of the law
questions.correctAnswer: By faith apart from works of the law
questions.explanation: Romans 3:28 concludes that justification is by faith without relying on the deeds prescribed by the law, emphasizing faith’s primacy.

questions.question: In Romans 3:29-30, Paul emphasizes that God is the God of whom?
questions.correctAnswer: Both Jews and Gentiles
questions.explanation: Romans 3:29-30 states that God justifies both the circumcised (Jews) and uncircumcised (Gentiles) by faith, stressing God’s universal sovereignty.

questions.question: What does Romans 3:31 say about the relationship between faith and the law?
options: Faith establishes the law rather than nullifying it
questions.correctAnswer: Faith establishes the law rather than nullifying it
questions.explanation: Romans 3:31 clarifies that faith does not nullify the law but rather upholds it, indicating continuity between faith and God's commandments.

questions.question: True or False: Romans 3:8 condones doing evil so that good may come.
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Romans 3:8 explicitly condemns the idea 'Let us do evil that good may come,' calling such reasoning deserving of just condemnation.

questions.question: According to Romans 3:6, what would be the consequence if God were unrighteous?
options: He could not judge the world
He would be praised by all
He would save only the Jews
questions.correctAnswer: He could not judge the world
questions.explanation: Romans 3:6 argues that if God were unrighteous, He would not be able to judge the world, affirming God's perfect justice.

theological.title: Romans Chapter 3 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Romans Chapter 3 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What is the primary advantage of the Jew according to Romans 3?
options: They were given the oracles of God
They have special privileges in society
questions.correctAnswer: They were given the oracles of God
questions.explanation: Romans 3:2 states the chief advantage for the Jew is that to them were committed the oracles of God. This aligns with Old Testament truth where God's covenant and revelation were given to Israel (Deuteronomy 4:7-8; Psalm 147:19-20; Acts 7:38).

questions.question: Does the unbelief of some Jews nullify the faithfulness of God?
options: No, it does not nullify God's faithfulness
Yes, it completely nullifies God's faithfulness
questions.correctAnswer: No, it does not nullify God's faithfulness
questions.explanation: Romans 3:3-4 explains that even if some do not believe, God's faithfulness remains intact. Scripture affirms God's immutability and faithfulness (Numbers 23:19; 2 Timothy 2:13; Hebrews 13:8).

questions.question: What does Paul say would be the consequence if unrighteousness commended the righteousness of God?
options: God would be unrighteous for taking vengeance
questions.correctAnswer: God would be unrighteous for taking vengeance
questions.explanation: Romans 3:5-6 argues that if unrighteousness commended God's righteousness, then God would be unjust in judging the world. This reflects God's holiness and justice (Psalm 89:14; Ecclesiastes 12:14; Revelation 16:5).

questions.question: What accusation does Paul reject about the teaching that one might do evil so that good may come?
options: He rejects that teaching and calls it damnation
He encourages doing evil for good
He is neutral about this teaching
questions.correctAnswer: He rejects that teaching and calls it damnation
questions.explanation: Romans 3:8 rejects the slanderous report that some say 'Let us do evil that good may come,' affirming that judgment for such a teaching is just. This aligns with biblical ethics condemning intentional sin (Exodus 23:7; Proverbs 17:15; Galatians 6:7).

questions.question: According to Romans 3, who is under sin?
questions.correctAnswer: Both Jews and Gentiles
questions.explanation: Romans 3:9 teaches that both Jews and Gentiles are all under sin, emphasizing universal human culpability consistent with Genesis 6:5, Psalm 14:3, Ecclesiastes 7:20, and 1 John 1:8.

questions.question: Which phrase summarizes the human condition as described in Romans 3:10-18?
options: No one is righteous; all have turned away from God
questions.correctAnswer: No one is righteous; all have turned away from God
questions.explanation: Romans 3:10-18 quotes Psalms and Isaiah to show no one is righteous or seeks God, describing universal sinfulness and rebellion, echoed in Jeremiah 17:9 and Ecclesiastes 7:20.

questions.question: What is the purpose of the law according to Romans 3:19-20?
options: To stop every mouth and make the world guilty before God
To justify people by their deeds
To make people righteous by works
questions.correctAnswer: To stop every mouth and make the world guilty before God
questions.explanation: Romans 3:19-20 clarifies that the law's purpose is to reveal sin and render all guilty, not to justify by works, consistent with Exodus 20:20 and Galatians 3:24.

questions.question: How is the righteousness of God manifested apart from the law?
questions.correctAnswer: Through faith in Jesus Christ
questions.explanation: Romans 3:21-22 reveals that God's righteousness is manifested apart from the law and is received through faith in Jesus Christ, consistent with Habakkuk 2:4 and Galatians 2:16.

questions.question: What is the universal condition of humanity described in Romans 3:23?
options: All have sinned and fall short of God's glory
questions.correctAnswer: All have sinned and fall short of God's glory
questions.explanation: Romans 3:23 states all humans have sinned and lack the glory of God, echoing Genesis 3, Psalm 51:5, and 1 John 1:10.

questions.question: How are believers justified according to Romans 3:24?
options: Freely by God's grace through Christ's redemption
questions.correctAnswer: Freely by God's grace through Christ's redemption
questions.explanation: Romans 3:24 teaches justification is a free gift by grace through redemption in Christ, consistent with Ephesians 2:8-9 and Titus 3:5.

questions.question: What role does Christ's blood play in God's plan according to Romans 3:25?
options: It is a propitiation for the remission of sins
It has no effect on sins
questions.correctAnswer: It is a propitiation for the remission of sins
questions.explanation: Romans 3:25 describes Christ's blood as a propitiation, satisfying God's justice and enabling forgiveness, consistent with Leviticus 17:11 and Hebrews 9:12-14.

questions.question: What does Romans 3:26 say about God's justice and justification?
options: God is both just and the justifier of those who believe in Jesus
questions.correctAnswer: God is both just and the justifier of those who believe in Jesus
questions.explanation: Romans 3:26 reveals God's justice is upheld while He justifies believers, harmonizing divine holiness and mercy as seen also in Psalm 89:14 and Isaiah 45:21.

questions.question: According to Romans 3:27, where is boasting excluded?
options: In the works of the law
questions.correctAnswer: In the law of faith
questions.explanation: Romans 3:27 teaches boasting is excluded by the law of faith, not works, emphasizing salvation by grace, consistent with 1 Corinthians 1:29 and Ephesians 2:9.

questions.question: How is a person justified according to Romans 3:28?
options: By faith without the deeds of the law
questions.correctAnswer: By faith without the deeds of the law
questions.explanation: Romans 3:28 asserts justification comes by faith apart from law works, highlighting the doctrine of sola fide, consistent with Galatians 2:16 and Philippians 3:9.

questions.question: Does God justify only Jews or also Gentiles according to Romans 3:29-30?
options: God justifies both Jews and Gentiles by faith
questions.correctAnswer: God justifies both Jews and Gentiles by faith
questions.explanation: Romans 3:29-30 states God is the God of both Jews and Gentiles, justifying all who believe by faith, consistent with Acts 10:34-35 and Galatians 3:28.
